{{Infobox WCBB Team |name = Bowling Green Falcons |logo = Bowling Green Falcons.svg |logo_size = |university = Bowling Green State University |conference = Mid-American Conference |conference_short = MAC |division = East Division |city = Bowling Green |stateabb = OH |state = Ohio |coach = [[Curt Miller]] |tenure = 10th |arena = [[Stroh Center]] |capacity = 4,700 |nickname = [[Bowling Green Falcons|Falcons]] |color1 = Brown |color2 = Orange |hex1 = 613005 |hex2 = FF7300 |h_pattern_b=_thinorangesides|h_body=FFFFFF|h_shorts=FFFFFF|h_pattern_s=_orangesides |a_pattern_b=_thinwhitesides|a_body=FF7300|a_shorts=FF7300|a_pattern_s=_whitesides |NCAAchampion = |NCAAfinalfour = |NCAAsweetsixteen = 2007 |NCAAtourneys = 1974, 1975, 1987, 1988, 1989, 1990, 1993, 1994, 2005, 2006, 2007, 2010 |conference_tournament = 1987, 1988, 1989, 1990, 1993, 1994, 2005, 2006, 2007, 2010, 2011 |conference_season = 2005, 2006, 2007, 2008, 2009, 2010 }} The '''Bowling Green Falcons women's basketball team''' is the [[Division I (NCAA)|NCAA Division I]] [[College basketball|women's basketball]] team that represents [[Bowling Green State University]]. The team plays at the 4,700-seat [[Anderson Arena]] on the BGSU campus in [[Bowling Green, Ohio]]. The Falcons are scheduled to move into the new 5,000-seat [[Stroh Center]] in 2012 after completion of the new arena in late 2011.http://www.toledoblade.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20100628/SPORTS03/6280359 The team is currently coached by [[Curt Miller]] who is in his tenth season with Bowling Green. The Falcons competes in the [[Mid-American Conference]] and has won the most MAC Championships, winning ten tournament championships since its admission into the MAC in 1981.http://mac-sports.com/ViewArticle.dbml?DB_OEM_ID=9400&ATCLID=1597826http://mac-sports.com/ViewArticle.dbml?SPSID=42881&SPID=3793&DB_OEM_ID=9400&ATCLID=205019485 The team last played in the NCAA Division I Women's Basketball Tournament in 2010.http://bgnewssports.com/mt/mt-search.cgi?blog_id=36&tag=sweet%20sixteen&limit=20http://www.usatoday.com/sports/scores107/107077/NCAAW763068.htm The Falcons became the first team from the MAC to reach the [[NCAA Women's Division I Basketball Tournament]] Sweet Sixteen, after they upset the second seed [[Vanderbilt Commodores|Vanderbilt]] 59-56 at the [[Breslin Student Events Center]] in [[East Lansing, Michigan]] in [[2007 NCAA Women's Division I Basketball Tournament|2007]].http://vucommodores.cstv.com/sports/w-baskbl/recaps/032107aab.htmlhttp://sports.espn.go.com/ncw/recap?gameId=293380238 ==Coaching history== [http://www.bgsu.edu/offices/mc/news/2010/news84793.html WBGU-PBS chronicles the history of BGSU womenâs basketball] {|class="wikitable sortable" border="1" Style="color: black" |- align="center" bgcolor="#dddddd" !Coach !Years !Seasons !Record !Pct. !Conf.
